sentence.Network_en: Out of Puritanism came the intense work ethic.
sentence.Network_cn: 严格的职业道德源于清教主义。

sentence.Network_en: Will severe selection standards create elitism and threaten the Olympic ethic of participation?
sentence.Network_cn: 严格的选拔标准是否会造成精英主义，进而危及奥林匹克重在参与的理念呢？

sentence.Network_en: They also boldly championed the Christian ethic and Western Culture tradition.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们还勇敢地维护基督教道德伦理和西方文化传统.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting ethics or moral philosophy; also used attributively): from Old French éthique, from Latin ethice, from Greek (hē) ēthikē (tekhnē) ('the science of) morals', based on ēthos (see ethos)

entry.def: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong.

example.ex: Its members are bound by a rigid code of ethics which includes confidentiality...
example.tran: 它的成员受到包括保密在内的一套严格的伦理规范的约束。

example.ex: Refugee workers said such action was a violation of medical ethics.
example.tran: 难民工作者说那种行为是对医德的亵渎。

entry.def: Someone's ethics are the moral principles about right and wrong behaviour which they believe in.

example.ex: It is common to distinguish between personal and social ethics...
example.tran: 个人道德准则和社会道德准则常常不一致。

example.ex: He told the police that he had thought honestly about the ethics of what he was doing.
example.tran: 他告诉警方说他确实考虑过自己所作所为依据的道德原则。

entry.def: Ethics is the study of questions about what is morally right and wrong.

example.ex: ...the teaching of ethics and moral philosophy.
example.tran: 伦理学和道德哲学的教学

entry.def: An ethic of a particular kind is an idea or moral belief that influences the behaviour, attitudes, and philosophy of a group of people.

example.ex: ...an indomitable work ethic and determination to succeed.
example.tran: 坚定的职业道德观和争取成功的决心

means.word_mean: 1. the principles of right and wrong that are accepted by an individual or a social group;
2. a system of principles governing morality and acceptable conduct

auth_sentence.content: Her best attribute may be her undeniable work ethic.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her best attribute may be her undeniable work ethic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her best attribute may be her undeniable work ethic.

auth_sentence.content: His slightly dishevelled appearance belies a strong work ethic.
auth_sentence.res_content: His slightly dishevelled appearance belies a strong work ethic.

auth_sentence.content: This is not simply a question of work ethic.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is not simply a question of work ethic.

Sentence.sentence: We might look to other countries for models of how high schools can offer better training, as well as the development of a work ethic ( 勤奋工作的美德 ) and the intellectual skills needed for continued learning and development.
This slippery slope of eroding ethics and bigger risks leads only to disaster.
Talent,charm,and an exceptional work ethic have rarely hurled any one of world's most successful entertainment icons and the first African-American female billionaire.
His ideas forced a reexamination of the early leadership paradigm (范例), which he observed centered on traits found in the character ethic and the personality ethic.
